abstract: Instead of policing the bonuses of executives, perhaps the government, and the public, should pay more attention to the policing of corporate boards.
snippet: Instead of policing the bonuses of executives, perhaps the government, and the public, should pay more attention to the policing of corporate boards.
lead_paragraph: Kenneth D. Feinberg, the Obama administration’s compensation cop, laid down the law on Wall Street when details of his plans to rein in excessive pay seeped out on Wednesday afternoon. The new measures call for slashing the pay packages of last year’s 25 highest earners at seven troubled companies that received multiple bailouts.

headline.main: Curbing Wall Street Pay, and the Corporate Boards That Set It
